title: Sojourner Truth's 'Ain't I a Woman?' Speech
description: A significant speech advocating for both abolition and women's rights.

title: National Woman Suffrage Association Founded
description: Founded by Susan B. Anthony and Elizabeth Cady Stanton.

title: New Zealand Grants Women the Right to Vote
description: New Zealand becomes the first self-governing country to grant women the right to vote.

title: 19th Amendment
description: Women gain the right to vote in the US.

title: The Second Sex Published
description: Simone de Beauvoir's influential book is published.

title: Introduction of the Birth Control Pill
description: The birth control pill becomes available, giving women greater control over their reproductive rights.

title: National Organization for Women (NOW) Founded
description: Founded to advocate for equal rights for women.

title: Title IX Enacted
description: A U.S. law that prohibits sex-based discrimination in federally funded education programs.

title: Alice Walker's 'The Color Purple' Wins the Pulitzer Prize
description: A significant achievement for African American women in literature.

title: Anita Hill Testifies Before the Senate
description: Anita Hill's testimony during Clarence Thomas's confirmation hearings brings sexual harassment into the national spotlight.

title: #MeToo Movement Begins
description: Tarana Burke starts the Me Too movement to support survivors of sexual violence.

title: Women Allowed to Serve in All Combat Roles in U.S. Military
description: A historic policy change in the U.S. military.

title: Ratification of the Istanbul Convention by Ukraine
description: Ukraine ratifies the Council of Europe Convention on preventing and combating violence against women and domestic violence.

title: Germany Introduces New Law on Women's Quota in Boardrooms
description: Germany passes legislation requiring a minimum number of women on the boards of large companies.
